oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The influence of the farming system on harvest of apple trees orchard and chemical composition of apples
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nominaitis, Skirmantas
Rutkoviene, Vida Marija
Viškelis, Pranas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Research of apple productivity and quality was carried out in organic and intensive farming in northern and central Lithuania gardens. Standard analysis and several new methods were used to analyse apple productivity and quality. Apples grown in the same climate and soil conditions using organic farming technologies were characterised by better taste and transport features and better electrochemical parameters, but the yield is less and fruits have an inferior marketable look.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nominaitis, Skirmantas; Rutkoviene, Vida Marija and Viškelis, Pranas (2005) The influence of the farming system on harvest of apple trees orchard and chemical composition of apples. [Ukininkavimo sistemos itaka obelyno derejimui ir obuoliu biocheminei sudeciai.] In: Heß, J and Rahmann, G (Eds.) Ende der Nische, Beiträge zur 8. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, kassel university press GmbH, Kassel.
